To help the @EnvAgencySE achieve a rapid response which will allow them to trace the pollution while the incident is ongoing, we need you to keep reporting it as soon as you spot the problem. Call 0800 80 70 60 with as many details as possible.

We have been in touch with @EnvAgencySE regarding these incidents. They have attended site on several occasions to try and trace the source of the pollution. However the source disappears before they arrive on site.

text:
5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding.

Would you know what to do in a flood? 👇 #prepareactsurvive

https://t.co/rxJRSdTlqt @EnvAgency https://t.co/WeTbTQugYS

@WandleForum @Wandle_Trust @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Please keep reporting this (0800 80 70 60) as soon as you see it. This will give them the best chance of getting to site during the incident and being able to trace it within the large surface water catchment before the source disappears.

@WandleForum @Wandle_Trust @EnvAgencySE @thameswater The main problem the @EnvAgencySE and @thameswater seem to be having is that they are are struggling to trace the precise source as it stops before they arrive on site.
We're looking into what we can do to help, including the possibility of taking samples.
Made some time this lunchtime to join an @EnvAgencyNW staff session on #ClimateChange a timely reminder of the big challenge we face https://t.co/6P9N0ap47u
